text:
It seems that Firefox in strict mode is blocking the domain `<http://hsappstatic.net|hsappstatic.net>` as it identifies it as a tracking domain. I learned that the list it uses is <https://github.com/disconnectme/disconnect-tracking-protection/blob/master/services.json#L6745|this one>.
It does not make any sense that `react-combined.mjs` and `island-runtime.mjs` are served from a domain that is already known to be flagged in the protection tracker as those are fundamental files to be able to run CMS-React. In my case, I have an Island that handles the navigation (amongst other things) and that it does not show when trackers are blocked.
I am not sure who can handle this, opening an issue with support with such complex topic can be a nightmare.
